metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2393 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The Neighbor Discovery (ND) protocol implementation in the IPv6 stack inFreeBSD, NetBSD, and possibly other BSD-based operating systems allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption and devicehang) by sending many Router Advertisement (RA) messages with differentsource addresses, a similar vulnerability to CVE-2010-4670.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
